Moreover, the ability of 0-dimensional biomaterials to influence cell behavior can also be dependent on their release of bioactive molecules over time. In conclusion, while it may be true that 0-dimensional biomaterials lack inherent inductive properties, they can be engineered to exhibit such properties through surface modifications, incorporation of bioactive molecules, and controlled release mechanisms.
